title: Duck Pond 2016 St. Jory Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Blackberry and chocolate are front and center, but this wine offers much more. It's creamy and lush on the palate, with mocha, toast and a touch of orange peel. The long, full finish brings in some black tea astringency.

title: Folded Hills 2016 Estate Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A beautiful shade of light purple in the glass, this first estate bottling off of this new property in the southwest corner of the appellation shows red currant, cherry and star anise on the nose. The palate starts with tangy black-raspberry fruit, but the focus is the compelling tannic tension and bright acid.

title: Folded Hills 2016 Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Roasted berries, dark cocoa, white pepper and a touch of tar make for a compelling aromatic entry to this bottling from the new project owned by Andy Busch from the famous brewing family. It's firmly textured on the palate, offering flavors of black plum, lilac and a hint of charcoal.

title: Fontanabianca 2015  Barbaresco
description: Enticing aromas of woodland berry, rose petal, underbrush and a balsamic note lead the nose. On the juicy, savory palate, notes of star anise, white pepper and mint accent a red-cherry core. It's well balanced, with fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2029.

title: Giant Steps 2016 Applejack Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)
description: This brightly-hued Pinot shows upfront fruitiness in a ripe red-berry tone, with underscores of pepper, flowers and herbal tea. As the wine opens in the glass, it gets smokier. The savoriness is even more defined on the palate, gliding alongside silky tannins.

title: Huett 2016 Folie Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Winemaker Ryan Huett labels this his “ultra” reserve—no doubt a reference to its single vineyard, single barrel origins. It's a mouthfilling explosion of black cherry cola, with pleasant, persistent highlights of tobacco, tea and lemon oil.

title: Infinito 2014 Winemaker's Selection Malbec (Mendoza)
description: A massive nose with huge blackberry and cassis aromas is ripe to the max. This Malbec is flush but still fairly fresh, so it succeeds in blending power with structure and balance. Flavors of blackberry and cassis show a chocolaty touch on the finish. Drink through 2023.

title: LaRue 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Winemaker Katy Wilson crafts a delicate, grainy and textured wine from coastal fruit in this light-bodied, crisp and fresh take on the variety. Impressive on the midpalate in establishing just the right amount of weight to give it complexity and bite, it finishes in a seductive layer of clove and cola.

title: Les Frères Couillaud 2015 Château de la Ragotière Vallet  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: This wine from Vallet, one of the new crus of Muscadet, has been aged for three years. That gives its richness a boost and introduces minerality, spice and intensity. The wine is packed with fruit and tightly textured. Drink now.

title: Melville 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Toasty aromas of seared lemon, citrus pith and ashy Brie rind show on the nose of this bottling from the longtime grape-growing family. The palate is extremely focused and sharp, offering lime sorbet, green pear and more pithy qualities, wrapped in a compellingly grippy texture.

title: No Girls 2015 La Paciencia Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: A bit lighter in color, the aromas offer notes of earthy funk, blackberry, wet stone, blood and smoke—not quite seeming fully ready to reveal their charms on first pour. Fruit and savory flavors coat the palate, showing a sense of elegance, energy and freshness.

title: Occhipinti 2014 Siccagno Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)
description: Sunbaked soil, leather, game, crushed black olive and black-skinned berry are some of the aromas you'll find on this earthy, soulful red. The vibrant palate has great energy, delivering creamy black cherry, spicy blueberry, orange zest and carob alongside fresh acidity and lithe tannins. You'll be rewarded if you open this up at least a few hours ahead of time to let it breathe and fully open up. Drink after 2020.

title: Occhipinti 2016 SP68 Red (Terre Siciliane)
description: A blend of Nero d'Avola and Frappato, this soulful red has earthy aromas of scorched soil, forest floor, new leather, truffle and grilled herb. The succulent, vibrant palate doles out crushed raspberry, juicy strawberry, orange zest, game and dark spice set against bright acidity. Soft tannins provide supple support. Some may find it rustic, but many others will love its terroir-driven personality.

title: Prinz Salm 2017 Quarzit Binger Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: Reverberating flavors of apricot and tangerine are framed by firm acidity and a pleasant bite of tannins in this stately, sleek dry wine. Full bodied and strident, the finish is long and steely. Drink now–2030.

title: Prinz Salm 2017 Vom Roten Schiefer Riesling (Nahe)
description: The nose is a tad savory here, suggesting delicate whiffs of dried herb, crushed stone and smoke. It's a zesty, citrusy wine full of crisp grapefruit and lemon flavors as well as a touch of peach. Full bodied and dry, it drinks well now but should improve from 2022–2030.

title: Proidl 2014 Senftenberger Rameln Auslese Riesling (Niederösterreich)
description: A slightly reduced nose dulls the bright notions of citrus that vividly dance on the tongue and unleash a panoply of passion fruit, candied grapefruit and lemon. The sweetness is cut perfectly by the zesty sharpness, while the body is luscious but light. Just made for a tarte au citron and other lemon zest-flavored desserts.

title: Proprietà Sperino 2014 Uvaggio Red (Coste della Sesia)
description: Heady scents of rose, iris, forest floor, white pepper and a whiff of wild herb take center stage on this fragrant ethereal red. Vibrant and savory, the linear racy palate offers morello cherry, raspberry, orange zest and star anise offset by polished tannins and bright acidity. A hint of iron defines the finish. It's already delicious but will offer fine drinking for the next several years. Drink 2020–2026.

title: Purple Hands 2016 Freedom Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This reliable vineyard delivers powerful brambly berry flavors in abundance. It's a big, textural, palate-filling wine, smooth and a bit tannic. There's a touch of green tea in those tannins, and it finishes with a hint of heat. Drink now–2025.

title: Roar 2016 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Noticeably cloudy in the glass, this single-vineyard exploration shows rich mulberry, black plum and candied rose-petal aromas. It's soft and creamy on the palate, where tart red plum and fresh thyme flavors prove a promising pairing.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Alegria Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Made from a majority of the variety blended with dozens of interplanted varieties that date back to the site's planting in 1890, this impresses in its lovely, lifted aromatics of nutmeg and clove. On the palate, expect blackberry cobbler and plum with an underbelly of balanced ripeness.
